review_text: This is a beautiful area for people to enjoy nature, in the city. We walked on a pedestrian bridge over the highway to get to the river. The bike path is 23 miles long. The path was paved and enjoyable to walk on with views of the river. This place was packed with joggers, bikers, and walkers. It was a chilly Saturday afternoon but was still busy. We even saw  someone slack lining by the trees. There were mini sailboats on the river with a great view of the city. There were benches along the way if you get tired. So many recreational options for people who use this river and path. Overall, a cool place to get some exercise and be one with nature.

The Charles River Esplanade is a peaceful and open space that's perfect for unwinding. It's a great spot for picnics, walks, or just enjoying the calm atmosphere. Watching the sunset here was absolutely beautiful. Whether you want some quiet time or to connect with nature, this place is a must-visit. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a calm escape in the middle of the city.

When spring arrives, there are many things we are truly excited about, and Cherry Blossoms are among them.

The beauty of Cherry Blossoms is undeniable; they seem to cast a spell on us. For those of us living in Boston, the Charles River Esplanade is one of the most beautiful spots to enjoy this natural art every year.

Many people come to this place to make the most of Boston's spring, engaging in activities such as running, picnicking, playing with their kids, and enjoying outdoor activities after a long winter, which is almost over, and welcoming the warm weather that is beginning to arrive.

The pink hues of the Cherry Blossoms blanket the entire park against the backdrop of the Charles River. We spend hours strolling around and cherish every minute spent in this amazing place, the Charles River Esplanade.
Amazing view. Nice parks. Places to sit and relax. Full of trees and plants. Watched fireworks from here. Also good for roller skating and stuff.

This place is my go-to spot for an evening run or a leisurely stroll, especially when catching up with friends. I adore the bustling atmosphere, especially with students bustling about, reminding me of the fast-paced nature of life. The highlight for me is strolling through Boston University and witnessing the vibrant energy of the students. The view alone makes the visit worthwhile.

Been here twice for the July 4th fireworks .
We had the best view to watch the fireworks and of course the place is beautiful as u see in pictures. Wonderful views especially during fireworks.
One of the best locations to sit and read a book. You'll catch a great sunset and some beautiful views of Cambridge / Boston. A great place to walk!
The Charles River Esplanade is a peaceful and open space that's perfect for unwinding. It's a great spot for picnics, walks, or just enjoying the calm atmosphere.
Great trail for a walk, jog, run, stroll, etc...
A beautiful place to walk, bike, and kayak. Great birdwatching all year-round.
Very peaceful
So pretty this season.
We went to the wading pool and it was the best park we went to in the Boston area!!
Quiet, nice footpath to walk or run, playground and kiddie pool
Great vista for seeing a range of water fowl, other birds,
Love bringing food to have a picnic and take in the city sights and people watching!

This is literally the heart of the city! the most iconic part of Boston and everyone is always around this place. For walks, for watersports or even just to sit and chill. This is a place you cannot miss out at all!
The Charles River in Boston is one of my faves! Walked along the river to the campuses of Boston University, MIT & Harvard University and for many peaceful morning walks!
Excellent kayaking and rowing venue, in addition to providing many beautiful photographic subjects.

There's many contenders for the greatest river in the world. Some say the mighty Amazon. Others may say the Nile, the very cradle of civilization itself. For me, it's the Charles, and you cannot convince me otherwise.
Relaxing place, love the view
A beautiful place for relaxing walks in Boston.
Beautiful Charles River. June 9th 2018.
Great place to enjoy the outdoors. No fish though....

Are you looking for a perfect place to go with your kid for bicycling? You must not miss this place.

We walked while the son enjoyed bicycling for miles. The trail is well maintained and wide enough. I highly recommend it. There were people from all walks of life - walking, running. There were benches to sit and relax on the trail.

We spent couple of hours here and would be returning back.

Update - 5/25/22 this time took the trail towards senior citizen center via Fino field. Almost plain and fully paved. Good time spent.

Update - 9/3/2023 love  being back here. New disc play area and clean and well maintained as it has been always. Noticed new construction  near parking.
Great place to take a run! Lots of entry points. And decent parking and several of them.
Very beautiful park, not overwhelming and easy trails for family fun

Nice trail running through parks and conservation areas in Milford and Holliston. We always go with our bikes and it's usually not too busy. The Milford section is paved and the Holliston part is stone dust.
This place has beautiful scenes ,swans,ducks,can walk dogs,might run into deers,you can bike ride and skate board,a lot of parking in fino field and close to lake
Great place for a walk, run, bike ride. Lucky to be a local with easy access to this resource. Nice way to spend some quality time outside!
This is a great trail! Goes through the woods, by the lake, and some across streets, with proper signals for bike crossing, it is also well maintained.  I love to bike and will be coming back
Nicely maintained paved bike trail with clear road crossings and signals to indicate pedestrian/bike crossing.

My new favorite launch on The Charles. Usually paddle the charles in Millis/Medfield area and I have never seen the water this clean. Its fall now and the foliage was beautiful. Another couple was at the boat launch when we arrived and said its uaually packed. I can see why. It really is so beautiful here. Can't wait to return and see what the spring has in store! Instagram: @kayakin_wonderland

Such a nice area!
Really peaceful, great for a picnic, easy to access by car.
Early fall best time of the year to visit: leaves are so colorful and birds are pretty active.

Only downside: those electric poles are so ugly they ruin the experience...

What a lovely stretch of the Charles River. This time of year not much wildlife.
However, the myriad of twists and turns offer many delightful scenes.
A bonus, if you call it that, is seeing some seriously impressive houses.
Light current and lots to see makes this a candidate for repeated paddles

Very cool park.  It made a great stopping point/lunch spot during our kayak trip in the Charles River.  Great kayak/canoe landing, benches, and plenty of lawn for picnicking, frisbee, a walk with the dog, etc.
One of our favorite walking spots, right on the Charles, usually not too crowded
I almost don't want to post because it's so quiet and scenic! Lots of spots by the water tho hang out and a huge pollinators meadow
Beautiful calm spot to kayak or fish (I think you can fish, don't quote me on that). There are a beautiful family of swans that live near this part of the river as well.
Feel like English countryside

Visited with my client 1 Staffs there make me so glad I don't put my family members at this place it is disgusting and disrespectful place I ve been to the worst staffs and administrators don't know how to keep things running I hope I never ever see this place again .
My friends

The Charles River Sightseeing Tour was a great way to spend a drizzly afternoon. This tour gives you a nice view of both Boston and Cambridge, along with some history on the buildings and bridges you pass by. The tour is just over 1 hour long with plenty of seating, most of which is covered.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for your review, Kylie! We're so glad you had a good time.

review_text: We had such a good time! Loved the narration, scenery, and overall experience. The narrator was awesome! Bartender & Narrator!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Chloe, thank you for sharing these awesome pictures and for your thoughtful review! We are so happy you enjoyed your cruise and would love to see you again sometime.

review_text: Everything was PERFECT for our rehearsal dinner onboard the Valiant! The boat created such a fun and unique experience for all of our guests, and left us with a memory we'll cherish forever! The food was amazing (highly recommend the chicken and waffles appetizer!), the staff was super attentive, DJ Keith kept the vibes high, and the interior of the boat was gorgeous! We are so grateful to Dayna for all of her help in coordinating the details for our special night. Everything from the food choices to the table decor was carefully thought through, and Dayna made sure it was all executed just as we wanted. It really felt like a customized event planning experience! If you're looking for the perfect venue for your next event, look no further -- Charles Riverboat Company is a 10/10 all around!
response_from_owner_text: Chelsea, thank you for your fantastic review! We're delighted to hear that your rehearsal dinner on the Valiant was perfect. From the amazing food, the boat and attentive staff, we're thrilled that every aspect met your expectations. It was a pleasure hosting your special night, and we look forward to welcoming you back for future events. We really appreciate your 10/10 rating!

review_text: We had a corporate event at the Valiant and it was just wonderful. From end-to-end, event team management to the crew! Thank you to Kaitlin, Melissa, Shelby, Rich and everyone that was on the boat yesterday with us! Amazing time!
response_from_owner_text: Marjorie, thank you for taking the time to leave us a review! We are so glad you had an amazing time and hope to have you onboard again sometime.

review_text: My wife's birthday party was a total blast!  A perfectly sized private boat, nicely set tables and tasty food, a good selection of drinks and an attentive service.  To top it off, a wonderful sunny and warm May afternoon and Boston/Cambridge lights in the evening.  Macoy, the event coordinator and organizer, was outstanding.  All in all, this is a highly recommended party venue!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for the glowing review! We're thrilled to hear that you had such a positive experience. Your feedback is greatly appreciated, and we look forward to having you onboard again in the future!

review_text:
If you've traveled to Boston to see and experience the City, then the Charles River Boat Architecture tour is the place to start.

Climb onboard a comfortable, roomy and well kept ship that has a well stocked bar, immaculate restrooms (heads) and a most professional crew.

The design of the ship optimizes your viewing experience through large windows and spacious seating. Or you can choose to stay on your feet and roam the deck if you desire.

Either viewing option is fine as long as you listen to your knowledgeable Guide who shares the history of Boston and can answer any historical question that comes to mind.

The Charles River Boat cruise was the highlight of our visit to Boston.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your fantastic review and sharing these fantastic photos! We're thrilled you enjoyed your time on our Architecture Tour. We're honored to be the highlight of your trip, and we look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable cruise!

review_text: Fun way to see Boston attractions. Relaxing as well.  Drinks are available on board.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your kind words and awesome pictures, Walid! We are so happy you enjoyed your cruise.

review_text: Absolutely a pleasure to work with. We hosted an event of ~100 graduate students on The Lexington and it was a huge hit. The staff support leading up to and during the event were excellent. Everyone was kind, helpful, and responsive - all around top notch customer service that has us excited to host another event soon. I would highly recommend for groups big and small!
response_from_owner_text: Sarah, thank you so much for sharing this wonderful review! It was such a pleasure hosting you all on the Lexington. We can't wait to have you onboard again with us in the future!

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: I went here and on a Saturday right when they opened. There weren't too many people there and it was very low key. Was pleasantly surprised by how thorough all the exhibits were and how the museum was laid out. I learned a lot about the history of Waltham industry.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text:
If you have an inquisitive grandson (or child) this pleasant museum helps explain the story of water/steam powered textile mills.

Worth a visit.

If you're local...better yet checkout the kid workshops.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text:
Wonderful wedding and reception. Nice location having cocktails while looking through the museum. Very large upstairs room was transformed to a nice venue. Fairy lights, decorations, very good food and drinks. There was plenty of room for dancing.
I would suggest more seating for the downstairs cocktail party. Older attendees and ladies in heals would appreciate it. Payed parking at an attached lot.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: It's impossibly difficult to find the entrance so do yourself a favor and go to the website for directions beforehand. Aside from that, this is one of my all time favorite museums. It's a treasure trove of detailed history for technical minds, engineers, and the mechanically inclined.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: As a museum, it's great if you love history and the Industrial Revolution. I loved the original phone booth, with its double doors. I wonder what past generations would think of the little super computers we keep in our pockets now. I also appreciated the items that haven't changed in a century- like the carpet sweeper! The watch collection was stunning. Overall, fascinating little museum.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: 20% off with AAA. The museum hasa wealth of treasures, from Ford model T to some local geniuses Metz, Moody and Lowell hydroelectricity or steam inventions. Nice quick tour about the importance of the site and incredible watch factory artifacts (how small some of these 140 pieces are!). $10 entrance without discount in April 2022, during weaver guild demos (a math feat!). Parking is on street and complicated there...

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: Wonderful museum. Learned a lot of historical facts about Waltham that are pretty significant. Spent a couple of hours here and will be coming back! One thing I'd like to note - you need to plan ahead and find the entrance location online. It's somewhat hidden. I had to go around the huge building and ask directions from the locals in order to find it.

place_name: Charles River Museum of Industry & Innovation
review_text: A small museum, full of history and interesting items. Everyone was so welcoming and happy to answer questions and share more information.
Beautiful display of fireworks on 4th of July.
Nice place to chill whether alone or with family and friends. Relaxing by Charles River is peaceful and there is a beautiful view.

We love grabbing ice cream at bi-rite close by every Sunday and chilling in dolores park. The vibe is great and on most days when the weather is good, a great place for friends to chill and enjoy the city view. We've tried almost all parks in the city, but this remains our favorite!
Clean walkway with scenic view of Boston skyline.
Nice for a walk around.
05/28 very nice weather. Windy and peaceful today. Great for walking around.

From Woerd you dead end into a circular turn around.  This is the Waltham side with fewer people, and really nothing except access to trails [yes you do walk past a house on either side from that little driveway, to get to the trails.
We see a local coyote there. The trail splits. Try the one going down toward swampy area for bird watching.
Wonderful place to kayak and birdwatch
Easy access to the Charles River
It's a great place,  thank you for this opportunity to enjoy this place .

Fantastic place to walk and enjoy the view. Incredible amount of activities with people having a good time and enjoying themselves. No homeless people begging, no drug addicts sprawled out ruining the moment. Just pure beauty and cleanliness. The kids really enjoy riding their bikes on the trail and lots of roller bladders and scooters as well. This place is a summertime gem and we will continue to return many times during the year. Highly recommended if you are in the area.

The reason I love Boston! Such a peaceful, calm and amazing climate here and a chill vibe. Green and fresh air and is good for meditation and yoga! Good cafe's nearby and is closer to the T. Jogging and dog walking possible. Also a great place to bring your kids around.
If you want a break from your regular routine life, this is the place.

We enjoyed watching the fireworks display on the 4th of July here. We luck out to be by the water and have the different display in front of us. Beautiful beautiful place... We were so happy. Such an incredible experience.. The kids never forget that wonderful experience. It was clean and there's lot of portable toilet too. Definitely will go again...
Really cool place to come and hang out on the Charles River!
The Best place to relax and perfect spot to watch the sunset which makes you more cheerful.
One of my most favorite places to watch the sunset, have a picnic and dance
A beautiful park for a bike or walk, right along the river! The dock is a great place for pictures or to rest next to the river.
It is my favorite place in all the entire city.

Gorgeous and accessible trail along the Charles River. Easy access to the neighborhood and lots of shade. Excellent wildlife and bird viewing opportunities. Many ducks and birds and even beavers!

There is a lot of poison ivy if you get off the trail, and some roots and rocks to trip over if you're not paying attention.

All the mud and streams are boarded and bridged so it's overall a very passable and pleasant trail.

Have attempted with an off-road stroller, but I would recommend carrying if you have little ones who aren't into walking. Many good opportunities to take breaks and eat snacks on logs and rocks while watching the wildlife.
Great trail and places to paddle. Birds and wildlife year-round.
Nice and peaceful trail
Calm & peaceful place with beautiful views.
Some parts aren't as wide or well maintained but overall had a tranquil walk with family including kids under 7
Pulled over for a ticket from officer speeding.  Nice location i do walk here just don't speed. 25 it is. My friend was doing 50. And two girl cops stopped her.
it's ok
Nice place for a walk

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text:
It's a great gym but the music's too loud, especially in the back room with the machines. If you bring your own headphones, you'll still hear their music. It's kinda hard to concentrate. Hopefully they can turn it down a little!

Edit: wait nevermind they turned it off I guess?

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: This gym is located in the basement with most of the gym equipment as outdated as the facility. Not only that, once I canceled my membership, they continued to charge me two weeks after and when I reached out for some clarification, they responded in a very passive-aggressive and rude way. For the hefty price you pay for the access to this subpar gym, I would recommend using that money and finding a way better gym for half of its price. The only reason I didn't give this place a one star review is because the trainers are nice.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: I go here for the indoor pool. It's maybe 15 meters? 3 lanes. Noticably shorter than half olympic. If you're near a YMCA or one of the university pools those are probably better for serious lap swim, but this is serviceable, super convenient, and not busy at all on weekday mornings. Have to reserve time in advance; half hour blocks. Rest of the gym seems nice. Lots of MGH folks and an emphasis on personal training services.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: Charles River Park is a relaxing health and fitness oasis in the center of the city with two pools (typically with multiple free lanes), excellent classes, trainers and equipment.  Although it will undergo outside pool deck renovations soon, it is maintaining interior pool access and swim times/classes. I recommend the water aerobics sessions for low impact/high resistance non-stop fun!  It's a pleasure to see families enjoying time in their cabanas - often returning year after year to commune and barbecue poolside.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: Love the facility. Staff is great and the equipment is good. There are 2 pools; indoor is open year round and the outdoor is a summer pool.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: I guess it's ok for the membership price? The pool is pretty small for lap swimming. Has an 80s feel like that John Travolta / Jamie Lee Curtis movie. Staff was nice, tons of lockers. The clients tho... A lady kicked me out of my swim lane even though I still had 4min left. I guess you can't control rude Bostonians from showing up in public places. I personally wouldn't recommend this place at least for swimming.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: The indoor pool is pretty small, very much looking forward to the outdoor pool when the weather is warm. Staff is really friendly, lots of equipment as well. It's a little chilly in there these days however it's tough to find a lap pool that you get a lane to yourself.

place_name: The Clubs at Charles River Park
review_text: Absolutely love this place. The staff are just amazing, the group fitness classes are excellent, the pool options all year round make it my favorite gym. Have been going almost daily for 3 years now.

CRC, especially the Grugan Center which is where I spent most of my time while being employed, is a great place to work. The staff & cliental are great people. You'll be guaranteed a smile & a laugh while working here.

Went for a covid vaccine.   The place is clean and very accessible for people who have disabilities.   The volunteers from Charles River Center and Pelmeds were wiping down all surfaces after each person (including the chairs). Overall it was a very positive experience and very safe.
A wide range of services: from school and day programs, to dances, to Holiday festivals and more....
I ran a race for the center , found staff and clients dancing together, live dj. Everyone was so friendly and I loved doing the run.
Poor poor place. Receptionist rude rude rude. Lacks professionalism. Odor to place all you could smell was urine. Wouldn't put an animal there.
They help those with various mental handicaps. They do a good job with their clients and their families.
They take great care for staff and the clients at all times
Very well maintained open space CBDS programs are good

The 2 preceding reviews don't reflect the real purpose of the CRC. The Conservancy has improved the cleanliness of the Charles River and has provided so many outstanding benefits to the Cambridge and Boston communities.
Nice conservancy I notice kids play there i thouht theres becehes
It's cool but I don't get it
Joe Mama

Had my 1st Kayak lesson with Deb. It was great she took the time to make sure I had the right size kayak and walked me thru all the steps including how to perform a rescue (get back in the kayak from the water). Such a great experience.
Terrific place. Very well run. Wished  other places could be as efficient and friendly as this place

I have visited this place on weekend and not much crowded. People working there were really helpful. For one person it will cost you around 33 dollars/upto 1.5 hours. For 2 persons it will be around 50 dollars/ upto 1.5 hours.

Currently you have to book a slot before hand online. Masks required during check-in, checkout. They have a series of outside socially distanced stations for the check in process. Life jackets are submerged in a bleach solution and dried for a day before reuse. Boats are sprayed down with a bleach solution between uses. I think they have made the rental process as safe as it can be given what we currently know about covid19. I've gone several times this summer already, and plan to go again.
Amazing day with a special girl. Staff were extremely helpful. Can't recommend this place enough.
Reservations worked well and room to distance. Very nice staff! Some very peaceful spots can be found with some paddling.
Excellent staff always.
Absolutely stunning!

My five year old son has been attending swim lessons at Charles River Aquatics for the last couple years. He loves it! Small class sizes, just three people in his lane with one teacher. During COVID, the instructors remained on the deck, but we strongly prefer the current set up with instructors in the pool. He is very comfortable in the water, and we're thankful for all of the excellent instruction. There is a family changing room and showers which he loves so he's not so cold after coming out of the very warm training pool.
response_from_owner_text: We love to hear that our young students love to swim with us!  We agree--it's great to be back in the water with our students!  Thank you for your feedback Timmy!  We look forward to many more great years of lessons with your son!

review_text: The best to improve!!!! All the coaches are fantastic and welcoming. My 2 daughters swim for CRA and they still say it was the best time!!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Alexandra!  We love to teach and coach. Thank you for swimming with us!

review_text: No matter where your kids start taking swim lessons, you will end up at Charles River Aquatics.  My son tried YMCA, Gold Fish (far and near).  My daughter did Brookline Rec.  Nobody will teach your child the real efficient and modern swim technique.  The instructors will watch arms and legs moves and correct them until the child has the proper technique.  Besides that the staff is really nice and very helpful.  My daughter finished level 4 at Charles River Aquatics and she swims beautifully.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Anna!  We love to hear that our technique-focused approach has been so successful in making your kids strong, safe and confident swimmers.

review_text: Best swim programs in New England! Both of my kids have taken swim lessons with CRA and my son has swum on their competitive swim team for 4 years. We tried tons of different swim lessons and programs in the area and found them to teach incorrectly and waste tons of time. Our son is an amazing swimmer thanks to CRA and our daughter is well on her way to being water safe and learning correct technique. All of the coaches and instructors are fantastic but most of all they have real swimmers in charge that oversee the programs well and pay attention to the individual kids. On top of it all, they have the nicest facilities around!
response_from_owner_text: Lacey , it's fun to hear a great success story!  It is our hope that a foundation in proper technique will lead to strong, fast swimming.  Pleased to hear that this is exactly your son's experience and that he is  now enjoying being part of a swim team.  Thank you for sharing your story!

review_text: Charles River Aquatics is a great swim school. My two daughters have taken lessons there the past 2 years and it's a very thorough and rigorous program.  Both of my children are confident and safe in the water.  My oldest child has now joined the swim team and she loves it!  She has improved her technique, made friends, and found a love of swimming.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Brandy!  We love to swim and to share that passion with our students and athletes!

review_text:
Had my son here for 3 months. Not a good experience.  When I originally had him evaluated, they told me he just needed to work on a straighter kick  and pointed toes.  We swim regularly, and I noticed that after 2 months of lessons, there was zero improvement.  If anything, his kick had gotten significantly worse.  And he had started coming out of streamline positions to doggy paddle.  Observing this, I checked in with the instructor, and the evaluator told me that he was doing a hybrid breast/freestyle kick with very bent legs.  (Which he had not been doing previously).
When I asked my son (he is 9 years old) about what he did in his lessons, he told me that they had him and another kid just kicking and racing across the pool, with little instruction.  Thankfully, last week was parent observation.  I watched as for the entire first 20 minutes,  as he did 4 laps kicking (incorrectly) with a barbell, breathing forward.  He received zero feedback or encouragement from the instructor.  We pulled him out of lessons that day.  $450 to be a worse swimmer!!!! What a rip-off!!!
This was such a disappointing experience for us, since I have older children and we had a really great experience with CRA lessons 8 years ago.  My older son still credits his good swimming ability to the lessons he took.  Sad that they have deteriorated so much!
response_from_owner_text:
As you know from your past experience with CRA, we have a unique approach to instruction with a laser focus on technique.  We use floatation devices (such as a barbell) deep into our levels to assist students in isolating movements with proper form as they commit foundational pieces to muscle memory.  We do believe that each individual responds uniquely  to instruction--an approach/philosophy that works well for one may not work for another.  Generally students and families who are committed to CRA and our approach to instruction emerge as strong, safe swimmers. 

We are disappointed to hear that your son has not had a positive growth experience with us.  We take feedback such as yours very seriously and will take it into consideration as we strive to offer the highest quality swim instruction.

review_text: There is a very little instruction and the kids keep doing the same skills over and over each week without any progression. The instructors are not invested in the kids progress, they rather show up each week to perform their usual 'prescribed' routines. With that said, the pool is clean and the facilities seem great.
response_from_owner_text: CRA has a unique approach to instruction, focused on proper technique.  Deep into our levels we work with students to isolate movements with proper form as they commit foundational pieces to muscle memory.  This requires a lot of repetition.  We believe that this approach is successful in developing efficient, strong and safe swimmers.  We are disappointed to learn that this is has not been a positive experience for your child. Thank you for your feedback.

review_text: My daughters truly could not be happier with their experience on the CRA Dragons Swim Team.  They had been on a YMCA swim team for many years before deciding to make the move to a bigger, more competitive team.  We joined CRA right as the pandemic was shutting things down, so when my girls were first able to swim there in summer 2020, they had to get temperature checks and wear masks when out of the water, plus social distance from peers and coaches, yet they were quickly able to make strong connections with other swimmers and coaches.  The facility was wonderful about COVID protocols through the past few years and now that those protocols have relaxed it has been a true gift to spectate at meets again.  The coaches are so experienced and professional yet are also warm and engaging with the swimmers, and it's obvious how much they care about not just the physical growth of the swimmers but about their social and emotional health.  All communications from all CRA staff have been clear and as a parent I feel like I'm truly in the loop and everything is transparent.  We have been thoroughly satisfied with our CRA experience!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for being a wonderful part of our CRA Family!

review_text: Very unwelcoming to newcomers. It's a bunch of judgmental senior citizens with too much time on their hands. They have 'house rules' that are not given to newcomers so they're able to get onto you for those rules in order to kick you out. Also takes your deposit and doesn't return it to you until the day you leave which is ridiculous, considering they give you a week notice to leave and you need that money to find a plan B. They hold meetings in which not everyone is invited to. Very cult like atmosphere, don't recommend unless you have the time and patience to deal with these people

WARNING!  If you are looking to join a yacht club stay clear of CRYC.  The board members do not have their act together, each one will tell you something different & their rules do not apply to them.  They withhold house rules from newcomers & then kick you out for not following the rules that you never knew existed, only send you their by laws.  One board member even admitted fault in forgetting to email their house rules.  The spineless board members hold a board meeting to discuss your membership & don't even give you the decency of letting you go in front of the board to join their CLIQUE instead send you a text message that you have a week to leave.  Their reputation  precedes them.  They should have a waiting list to get in this yacht club but don't considering the unfriendly, judgmental, stuck up, descriminating environment ran by a bunch of old men that have nothing better to do than nit pick anyone that is not welcome in their clique.  Do your homework & ask around before joining.  I sure wish we did!
Absolutely beautiful day at the Charles River Yacht Club...met some nice boat people and had a few laughs...
Best yacht club on the Charles River!
Located on Memorial drive and has an amazing view of the city
Vert cool. Love it
Pleasant place to relax on a summer's eve.
Parking is hard but club is best on the Charles

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text:
Every1 is very friendly, encouraging & helpful. I would go again if the weather is nicer!
The staff were very nice to let me in where is Air conditioned & gave me a chair.  1 of the staff gave my son an ice pack & they provided water & gatorades for every1. It was too hot 90 degree weather.
It's definitely A good time! I recommend this place if you enjoy tree climbing.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Catherine.

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: Wow! What an epic adventure! If you love a good challenge and aren't afraid of heights, this place is AWESOME! The only thing we wish we did differently was buy the three hour ticket, not the two hour. We wanted more time to do all the courses. The staff were helpful, friendly and it was easy to find someone if you needed to. Don't fret about the sun either, most of the courses are up in the trees :)
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Leah! We hope you can come back again soon!

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: We just my son's 9 YO birthday party here.  The boys had an absolute blast and the staff was incredible.  We hired a guide for the party and she did a great job with the boys who were feeling confident.  A few boys were more nervous and the staff came to help them 1:1.  It was amazing and helped all the boys enjoy the party at their own pace.  All the boys left feeling proud of their accomplishments!  It was a beautiful night.  Pizza delivery from Vina's was super convenient.  Highly recommend this incredible experience for parties and families!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Jill. We are so glad your party was a success! We love when everyone is able to have a good time while also gaining some confidence along the way.

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: We had a blast! We love that the course offers multi levels so you can challenge yourself when you feel ready. Thank you for a great time!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Ann!

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: I took a friend here for our first climb (5:30pm reservation, we booked a same day reservation as we were driving towards the park) on 5/12/24. We arrived at 6:30pm due to traffic. The park was almost closed. The assistant manager Demetrius (not sure if I spelled their name right) still let us climb. Another staff member Kacie (not sure if I spelled their name right) even climbed with us since everything was getting a little dark (the park has stream lights on though) and gave us tips on all the climbs. Overall a great experience and fantastic staff. I would 10/10 recommend going again.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Quan Ho. We are so glad to hear that we were able to accommodate your late arrival and make your visit extra special!

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text:
I loved Boundless adventure. I did two yellows,  one green and one blue and was quite challenged.
I want to return and build up for other levels. The staff were helpful and friendly.
They have lockers only for a fee.
I was annoyed every time I wanted to start another course I needed to stand in line at the start. On a busy day that could be very slow.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for giving us a 5 star rating. I'm sorry for the line. We do need to check everyone's harness and ensure that they are going on the right course for their ability.

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: My kids (14yo and 16yo) had great time there. All of the employees were very friendly and knowledgable of the equipment and all of the courses. The time frame was great, they had plenty of time to do some courses take a break and go back. We will definitely be going back.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Gino!

place_name: Boundless Adventures Zipline and Aerial Park
review_text: Boundless Adventures was an amazing trip for my 15 year old nephew and I. It was easy to book online and reservation details and reminders were sent prior to the event day. The staff were friendly and helpful. We got a safety briefing prior to climbing and staff were available through the course if help was needed. You can bring your own food/drink or buy snacks from the concession. Will absolutely be spreading the word about this place and coming back for more !
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Danielle! The best way to grow a business is by positive word of mouth. We do hope to see you and your nephew again soon!

review_text:
Very nice restaurant at a special and exciting location, at the top of the Prudential tower, with beautiful panoramic views of the greater Boston area. Celebratory atmosphere, especially on weekends. It's very pleasant to dine here as part of a special occasion.

The food was interesting and good, but not great since the options were limited. We don't like goat cheese, especially deep fried. The beef was soft and tasty but greasy, gave me heartburn. The cocktails were good but too sweet. It was fun to see the bartenders in the open bar.

The service was very good, the staff is professional and friendly.

But not 5 stars because of the high prices, about $80 per person for a full meal, in addition to $25 pp to get to that floor. The food was not so exceptional to justify the price, but again- the main attraction is the special location. By the way, parking in the Prudential garage on a Friday evening cost us $46 (Ouch), you may wanna look for more reasonable options.

Good experience overall

I regret to say that my recent visit to The Beacon at View in Boston was disappointing. We ordered the Spirit-Free Dining for two people, which included the Baked Stuffed Clams. Unfortunately, one of the clams was severely overcooked to the point of being nearly inedible. When the server checked on us and asked if everything was satisfactory, we explained the issue, expecting a solution similar to what we've experienced in New York--where staff typically communicates with the kitchen to resolve such issues with great attitude. Shockingly, the server accused us of complaining only to seek a refund, insisting that we had eaten half of the burnt clam already. She defensively claimed that the clam was meant to be that hard and even suggested that the kitchen would affirm it was fine as is. No attempt was made to rectify the situation, and the server did not remove the spoiled food, nor did she offer any resolution. Her demeanor was off-putting throughout the meal. As we were preparing to enjoy the sunset and take photos, she abruptly dropped the bill on our table without prompting, seemingly trying to rush us out. This was among the worst service I have ever encountered. I believe if you are confident in your food, there's no need to superficially ask if everything is alright without being willing to address the issues presented.

BIGGEST SCAM OF THE CITY!! AVOID AT ALL COST!!
I wanted to give them the benefit of the doubt, ignored all the bad reviews and made a reservation for the restaurant.  NOWHERE in the reservation section does it say that you MUST buy an entrance ticket ($30 p/p) even if you are just there to eat at the restaurant. I have friends in town and we were ready to spend whatever $ to eat at the restaurant.
I do not appreciate that they force you to buy tickets even though you will be spending more money at the restaurant.  Ridiculous!!
GET THIS!! Because it was a rainy day in Boston, they dropped the tickets down from $30 to $10, BUT, the only way to buy these tickets is via the kiosk that charged you $3 p/p .  i lost it and cancelled everything.  Ramsey's Kitchen was happy to have us! DO BETTER BEACON, RIDICULOUS!
Brought my mom for her Birthday. Great view, fabulous foods. John and his colleagues served us brilliantly.

Charming restaurant at the top of Prudential Tower. The food was good but the service was definitely lacking. Came in and wanted a table by the window, "reservations only." There were approximately three tables open the whole time we were dining without anyone sitting in them. I asked if we could get a normal table and front hostess gave us attitude like we were some peasants. The server was great but the place needs more servers. Slow slow slow.

Food is amazing! My husband and I came to Boston from Miami on vacation. We didn't know about this place. We discovered it when we purchased the tickets for Boston View. It was the most wonderful experience. We loved everything from the service to the food and the view. You've got to try the goat cheese fritters, they're beyond this world! It's worth every penny you spend to go up. We were here for a week and we came twice to this place. That's how amazing it is. Highly recommended!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for taking the time to share your positive comments about your experience at View Boston! We hope you left with an itinerary full of fun activities to explore during the rest of your stay here in Boston. We hope to see you again when you return!

review_text:
The lobster roll was delicious.  Included is a non-alcoholic drink of your choice.  Refills are five dollars each.

The views are going to be the best that you will get in Boston unless you work in a nearby tall building.  The seating and furnishings are top level.

The service was just OK and that's because the tip is already paid for before the service. In this case, the hostess really saved the day by bringing the water pitcher and filling my water. So the $47 lunch experience ($35 plus taxes and tip) from OpenTable is worth the price since you get the views.  Keep in mind that the service can be subpar because the servers already have their tip so they don't have an incentive to pay attention.

This lunch experience also came with the View Boston.

Really good food at this restaurant! Only downside is that you have to pay to go to The View at the top of Prudential which can be anywhere from $10-25.

The staff was average at best, a lot of miscommunication, slow order taking, incorrect orders taking place. The quality of service was average at best as well.

Would recommend coming for the food if you're already going to be in the area to enjoy the gorgeous view of the city (especially the Airport!).

Today I ran by here and saw a full solar eclipse! It was remarkable! I could not believe my eyes! It happened so fast I was unable to realize it. The weather channel or NASA did not even know about it. But I saw it and I have video evidence!
Nice park for a walk, run, or bike ride. Beautiful water front views. Nice place to get from one area to the other without having to walk through city streets.
Cool place to chill and walk
Beautiful park to bike ride, walk, or just bring a lunch.
Great walks. Terrific sunsets! A must if you live here
Nice place to sit and relax. Cool Breeze along with nice sunset view

Great photo ops, the Hatch Shell, Charles River, Lagoon and the abstract of the maestro is a must for any photo reminder of Boston.  They offer serious Yoga during the Summer, there is nothing quite like Yoga as the Sun sets over the Charles River which contains over 18 fish species.

So bring the family for picknicking, running, walking, biking, boating, Jazz or hang out at the outdoors Beer Garden.

This whole Esplanade park along the river is perfect for running, biking, walking, or setting up a hammock. With all the sailboats out on the water, and with the sun setting on the other side of the river, it's one of the most beautiful sights in the city!

This is a wonderful weekend. For racers a fantastic event. Do it if you ever have a chance. For spectators, pick your spot! The rowers can hear you as they come under the Weeks footbridge; the trickiest turn is under the Eliot bridge (also where the announcers are located, and they identify each crew and often offer a bit of history and words of encouragement as they go by); and the  finish line offers food, vendors of all descriptions, and the chance to say "hi" to your rowers after they relax.

The head of the Charles was an amazing event. My school raced in it and it was thrilling to watch them go down the river. It was very crowded and packed full of commercial venders. Food is quite limited and overpriced. I would recommend just going to real restaurant and getting food if you have the time. If you have never been to the Head Of The Charles, then you should put this on your list.
Epic event! Well run and well attended. Just need more water trucks to refill water bottles. Thank you all the volunteers.
Beautiful river, excellent rowing.
Had a good time at the 2016 event watching the crews go by in challenging conditions. Very interesting to visit all the equipment vendors! Great crowd.
Great weekend of repeat performances and repeat experiences.  Love this regatta! Looking forward to coming back 20 more times and maybe even racing with my kids.  So much fun!

What an excellent regatta!  I raced here on 10/19/13 and was really impressed by the size of the regatta and the excellent coordination that went into making this race run seamlessly.  The Charles is a stellar course!
Best view of the river

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text:
This is a beautiful trail with a lot of benches, boardwalk offshoots, bridges, playgrounds, and art installations along the walk. It is paved in most areas, dirt, and gravel in the rest.
This is a great trail to walk along in the summer because the trees provide shade. Just remember to bring bug spray because the water doesn't move fast and it can become very buggy.
There are a lot of free parking spots along the  part in downtown watertown, but they are 2 hour maximum. So watch your time!

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text: The trail is good for a short walk albeit unpleasant smell from the river! Beautiful view of the river! A chance to take a photo with a boat on the ground!

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text: So beautiful, clean, quiet, peaceful, easy to park and nice location. during the Covid-19 time, it was the gate that took me to beauty of the world  that I was living in without appreciate what I have. I highly recommend  who ever want to enjoy the life at this time to go there.

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text: This is a really fun place and combines the best of a park, a trail, and a waterfront. The 2 hour parking alongside Charles River road is very helpful. Perfect for A Walk to Remember

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text: This is a nice place to walk or run along the river. Plenty of basketball hoops and family oriented with a playground.

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text:
This is a gorgeous walking trail along the river. There are some piers to fish from, and a few spots to sit, and a couple different play areas for kids. One area has a playground with a basketball court that has 4 baskets.

Another is a clearing with canoes for kids to sit on, and an outdoor xylophone. The xylephone sticks are strung to it, so they aren't taken away by weather or someone who thinks they're funny. A neat touch: the xylephone notes have braille on them.

The trails could use more benches, and I didn't spot any trash cans besides the one along the streets are the start. It could use some lights for the night, too. Make sure to use bug repellant.

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text:
Most beautiful, peaceful place ever........Luv,Luv,Luv it.
Relax,walk canoeing or just enjoying good old people watching.

place_name: Watertown Riverfront Park and Braille Trail
review_text:
The Riverwalk is a lovely area for walker's, joggers and bikers to enjoy. In recent years Watertown has installed a raised path, lookouts w/benches and a bridge near the Waltham stretch. They're currently working on the section near the park/playground and path parallel to the old Arsenal Mall.

There is much work that still needs to be done. There are many sections along the path that need to be widened (not ADA compliant) , paved, benches, Picnic tables, lighting for safety and trash / recycling barrels at every entrance are especially needed to cut back on litter in the river.

Other additions that would improve the path would be educational placards or monuments to tell the history (this section of the path has a rich Native American history), sculptures / art installments, healthpath equipment and better markings along the trail with downloadable maps would be very helpful additions.

The sprinkler park real neads to be redone and pool area looks quite underwhelming.

Stunning!  Always ducks and seagulls and so on!  There is two hour parking all along the street by the bridge, and it's shady too so good for hot days like today!

I always see people fishing, and there is a sprinkler park not far.

This is a scenic spot along the Charles River trail! It's a beautiful small waterfall/dam. You can view it from both the north and south side of the trail. The north side has an overlook. The south side has a walking area right up to the river at the base.
Nice trail for both jogging and biking with a scenic view of the river falls.
Relaxing to just look at the water flowing and the nature. Sun shines bright on the water past noon makes it worthwhile.
I work right next to the dam. So much calm and peace,  and never too crowded. There are plenty of parking in the office spaces around during weekdays and weekends.
lovely area to view wildlife and walk in mostly shaded paths.
Great place to walk around river and you will notice many people are enjoying fishing  in different spot.

A beautiful spot to walk and watch the wildlife. It's common to find great blue herons and night herons fishing here. Sometimes if your lucky you can even find a large snapping turtle sunning itself on the rocks below the dam.

We had an excellent experience cruising an evening on a boat rented by Harvard Business School - excellent service by the boat staff - some people came back again for the Sunset cruise on the Charles.   Highly recommend that!

Located right in the head of the Charles rowing epicenter. You can hear centuries of coxswain calls spurring collegiate crews across the smooth waters.
A small but well run house that would easily inspire new or veteran rowers to spur victory.
The boat cruise along the Charles River was awesome. The scenery and the history are an excellent thing to experience at least once
Fantastic experience racing out of this boat house.  Thank you Charlie Butt!
Full of history! No rower should pass up a chance to visit the Newell Boathouse!
Beautiful boathouse on the scenic Charles.
Had awesome time while back :))
Very nice

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: So I hit the water in my "new to me" used loon kayak and I simply cannot be more satisfied with the value for the money. But more than that is how happy I am with the service, advice, and attention to my customer needs and "emerging paddling enthusiast" questions. Ben took the time to walk me through kayak options and answered questions thoroughly and engaged with thoughtful conversation that helped us move to the best kayak brand and size for me and then he looked through the inventory to find the best possible showing me exactly what I was getting in a used kayak-- which is pretty much a yak with a few scuffs but at about half the price of a new one! I wanted a paddle and once again I felt I was to find not only what I should get but why it was the best for me. I really appreciate how comfortable the sales experience was, the obvious enthusiasm for the sport, and the honest feedback (both pros and the cons) that helped me make an informed purchase! Bonus was good training on how to load my boat on my roof and properly tie it down... a small detail maybe but the extra time to make sure I was safe speaks volumes to how valued I felt.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much Robert! We really appreciate your review and that you were so pleased with the service and the equipment. We hope your Loon is still treating you really well and we'd be glad to answer any questions or new gear requests you might have! paddle on!

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: Great shop, enjoyed talking to Bryce who was super knowledgeable, answered all of our questions, and helped me pick a nice canoe paddle!

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: Stopped by the paddle shop to get my own life jacket as I've picked up kayaking this summer. One of the staff members spent ~1 hours helping my partner and myself pick the best life jacket for us. He was very knowledgeable and patient. I cannot give them higher praise! We'll definitely be back
response_from_owner_text: Thank you very much Sarah! Jonathan is glad to hear how helpful you found him! We appreciate you coming in and spending the time to get to know us, the products and selecting the right equipment for yourself and partner. Please reach out with any questions at any time for any reason.  -Best, The Paddle Store

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: Very helpful staff, huge selection and 5% discount on accessories when buying a kayak. Turns out I also got a 5% off on my kayak! I would definitely recommend this place to everyone!
response_from_owner_text: Hey DWS! we really like to hear that! Send you friends in, we love sellingoats and are happy to asnwer questions!

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: Marc and Jonathan are extremely helpful and  attentative for all your needs...Highly recommend!!!  Happy Boating!!!
response_from_owner_text: Thanks Karen!! Appreciate your kind words and continued business. Enjoy your summer on the water and see you again soon. Marc

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: We are so thankful for the staff at Charles River Canoe & Kayak!  They were knowledgeable, helpful, and patient with all of our questions when purchasing our two used kayaks a few weeks ago.  Since we were unsure as to which boats to purchase, we took the opportunity to test drive boats at the Newton site and that staff from start to finish were so friendly allowing us to load, paddle and return back to switch boats with each other, and paddle again.  After our "test drives", we drove back to the paddle store to purchase a Loon and a Pungo.  We have had the best time on the water already the past few weekends, confident in our equipment and in our transportation strapping, thanks to the awesome staff.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for your kind and thoughtful review! It was a pleasure working you and we're delighted to hear that you've been getting out on the water in your kayaks. It's a beautiful time of year to explore our local waterways. Happy paddling!

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: Always very helpful and friendly. I had a kayak that needed repair and they helped me to fix it right away when the shop I had bought from wasn't helpful at all. I have used this shop for many things over the years and appreciate all the services they provide. Great shop and people. Have also rented paddle boards and kayaks from there other locations and had a lot of fun over the years.
response_from_owner_text: Susan, thank you very much for your kind words! We appreciate you choosing us to do business with and will do all we can for yourself, your friends and family you send our way! Come by and visit anytime!

place_name: Charles River Canoe & Kayak : Paddling Store
review_text: I found a boat online I was interested in, price was unbeatable. One of the owners helped me, he had the boat brought over from a different location and while I was waiting he explained everything about the boat and got me everything else I needed. Start to finish it was a great experience.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Shaun! We are glad to get you outfitted and hope you have a great experience with the boat! Keep in touch with any questions! Tight lines!

review_text: I was just thinking today how nice it is to have Whole Foods there. Had a great breakfast for a good price. The organic peaches were pretty ripe and on sale.

Nice CVS ,clean and neat
Staff Pleasant on approach, helpful to customers.
Pharmacists are knowledgeable  and friendly .
My wife had an appointment at Mass Eye and Ear, and I was able to order food at one of the restaurants in the area to bring home while I waited to take her home.
I have live in Boston for over 25 years and had never walked around this area. I had such a great time exploring. There is so much history here. A great place for walking in general.
Had a doctor's appointment and then had a nice lunch at Whole Foods

Fantastic facility clean safe
I really enjoyed the experience

There are a lot of useful businesses and doctors offices in this plaza, but the parking lot is hit or miss. Sometimes you can't find spaces, sometimes it's empty, and sometimes people exiting are stuck at the payment machine and The parking lot attendants don't seem to come out of the office to deal with the situation unless someone goes and gets them.  You can be stuck in this plaza for 15 minutes just trying to leave.
Quite busy place as it is near the Hospital. You can have more or less all kind of stuffs for your daily need.

My friend and I had done this adventure for the first time and had a blast! It was great to snow-tube and then have a meal and beers afterwards at one of the local breweries. The tour guides were great and it was nice to meet other people at the same time. I would definitely recommend this to other people!

Awesome time!  The host was great very friendly and accommodating.  Tubing was fun and at the brewery we played fuss ball with others that were there.  I definitely would do it again although it was a trip for us as we live in Connecticut.

Had a blast! Nice little tubing adventure for folks [us] who hadn't played in the snow since childhood. The Brewery was cool too. I just wish they had other options like cider for non-beer drinkers. Jamie was cool too! Definitely recommend and will look for other outings with Sourced. - Mrs. Osinubi (Roxbury, USA)

My husband and I used Sourced Adventures in Boston to take an awesome trip snow-tubing, followed by dinner and a great local craft brewery with friends. It was easy, affordable, and a great way to spend a Saturday! I highly recommend using this company for escapes from the city life whenever you want some good old fashioned fun.

I did the snow tubing trip with Sourced Adventures! It was pretty awesome and I had a blast. Everything was well organized. They picked us up on time (I had the Newbury street pickup) and kept everything lighthearted and fun. I would 100% recommend!

So much fun. Me and my girl are going again this Saturday. They weren't messing around with good times and hearty dinner. Our food was from "Rail Trail". We loved it so much, we drove up to eat there from RI.
I loved it! It is so much fun! We got so lucky with the weather. and brewery itself was amazing with games, yummy beer a lot of fun people and good food!
Awesome time with this group! From a girl from FL, the snow tubing was so much fun! & the brewery was even better.. Friendly, fun people and great beer!

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: The swimming pool has well-trained lifeguards.  Today I saw a swift rescue.  One lifeguard jumped into the middle lane of the pool to rescue a struggling old female swimmer. He skillfully pull her into the shallow side of the pool.  Great job!  Isaiah!

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: We switched over from Lifetime Fitness to Charles River YMCA in 2021 and the rest is history.  This gym is not excessively big or commercialized which gives off a true community-based feeling.  I also love this Y for being very kid friendly.

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: YMCA has a safe pool for my children, they are very attentive to each person who is swimming. The place is very nice. My children are happy to go swimming there.

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: It's a small gym, no doubt, but definitely has pretty much everything you could need. If you're a gym rat who NEEDS a rack at all times, there's only one for everyone to share, but that being said, the gym-goers at this Y are generally not of that variety and you might only need to wait for one person to use the rack ahead of you if at all. The staff are friendly, the facilities are always clean, the Zumba classes on Saturday and Sunday mornings are SO good (some of the best in Greater Boston, no doubt). For folks hating on this Y, they're just used to bigger more glamorous gyms. This place definitely does the job and is so convenient if you live in the area.

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text:
This YMCA branch has become a real life-saver for me this winter as the temperatures dropped and I couldn't work out/run outside anymore. Their covid-related reservation system is also a good incentive not to skip gym and to schedule your busy day around the workouts. Also love the fact that I can just come in and work out at my own pace - no pressure to take group classes/personal training sessions that sometimes occurs in "regular" gyms. Very relaxed and friendly atmosphere.

The only downside is that it's almost impossible to sign up for the swimming pool - it's almost perpetually overbooked!

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text:
The Charles River YMCA is a wonderful gym and community.  I have been a member for several years and participate in many group activities such as Barre, Pilates and Zumba.  All the folks at the Y also did an awesome job keeping me active during the pandemic by offering virtual classes and now hybrid.  I'm glad to be back in the gym and look forward to attending more live classes.

Thank you, YMCA!

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: Nice, small gym - has all the equipment one needs. Reasonably priced, friendly staff

place_name: Charles River YMCA - Great Plain Ave
review_text: The Charles River YMCA is fantastic, it has two locations in Needham, with weights, a pool in one location and lots of activities and classes.  My wife loves the Zumba class, and we love that there is child care at the Chestnut Street location (specific days and times).  Friendly people, a non-profit that is helping communities, great organization!
Iconic Boston landmark where I usually schedule meetings with friends. We meet on the steps of this historic building.

I lived in the steeple for a while in the 70's. There was a hidden door halfway up the staircase to the church worship area on the second floor. I spent the blizzard of 78 there! The one way traffic pattern went the other way on Charles St back in the day.
I loved visiting this place because of the historic buildings and the beautiful grounds!
Well, they didn't let my 18th century cos play society use the meeting house for our rum Cotillion but maybe next year!

Very important historical place that survives as an office building and collection of shops. Sadly, the interior of the church has been lost, but the result is a good example of architectural preservation nonetheless.
Glad we got to see it while in the city. Did not take the tour.
The place has a Tatte location home of the Tatte Latte which is a slice of heaven.  There are benches outside to sit at
Why is so hard to find when you follow Google maps? Not good for people who don't live in boston and come to visit

I went here for the first time yesterday 6/4/24. The place is Amazing. Probably the cleanest park I have been to in Massachusetts. I spent 3 1/2 hours there and only saw a portion of it. The trails are immaculate and an easy hike. I almost found in Magical, maybe because I was pretty much the only one there. Well worth the $6 buck entrance fee. They obviously use that money to maintain the Sanctuary in such pristine shape. I Will Return.

day9(03JUL24) sanctuary18.
wrong turn out of nature center (their map is clear, my interpretation perhaps less so) put me on glacial hill trail. was able to navigate trail system to get to river loop trail. the charles river is as muddy as you might imagine. forest plant community changes every couple hundred feet. boardwalks over oxbow ponds provide easy access to marsh and pond habitats. lots to see, lots of trails to explore.

Lovely place for hikes. I'm amazed at the length of trails that wend their way through a comparatively small property. Lots of birds and other wildlife in the marshes and low wooded hills. Lots of little nooks to explore and free to Natick residents!

Scenic trails and an interesting variety of terrain make this one of my favorite places to go for a hike near my home. Huge fan of the boardwalks that cut through the Charles river watershed and marsh areas. The trails are well maintained and staff is informative and friendly. Always a treat visiting Broadmoor.
Beautiful! I went on the holiday weekend and though there were a lot of people, it never felt crowded. So much wildlife and natural beauty!

Nice place for a walk. You can pick up trail maps at the visitor center. Multiple trails, easy terrain.
Also: there is a level 2 charger (6kWh) for EVs. Charging at a reasonable price ($0.28/kW at the time of writing) through ChargePoint.

Your next favorite nature walk! The sanctuary has 9 miles of trails and boardwalks through fields, woodlands, and wetlands; all abundant in wildlife.
Consider packing a snack for yourself and some birdseed, as there are many great outlook locations to rest at and enjoy. Admission is free for Mass Audubon Members, $6 for Adults, $4 for Children, $4 for Seniors.
Great spot for a hike.  Went in the winter and didn't see many birds but I heard them.  It was fun trying to identify the tracks in the snow.  Would definitely go back in the spring or summer.

Friendly, efficient, help you in and out of kayaks. Basic sit-inside kayaks but dry and clean. Life jackets were good quality and they checked for proper fit. On arrival you must watch a quick safety video and sign waivers. They will rent you a dry bag for car keys etc. ample parking nearby and a public restroom a short walk away.

Paddle Boston in Kendall Square is a great spot for kayaking during the summer. The location is perfect, right on the Charles River, offering stunning views of the Boston skyline and a refreshing escape from the city's hustle and bustle. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, making the rental process smooth and efficient. The equipment is well-maintained and clean, ensuring a safe and enjoyable experience on the water.
We had an amazing time kayaking on Charles River. The staff were welcoming, professional and helpful. Definitely recommend seeing the Boston Skyline that way.
Had a great kayak on the Charles! Great location. Quick and easy set up. Friendly staff.

This is a must do activity in Boston! The staff was friendly as well.
I would recommend going earlier in the morning just so that the sun doesn't sting later on as there's no shade along the river.
10/10 would recommend for Boston residents and visitors alike! Rent a kayak, double kayak, stand up paddle board, or other types of boats. It's a beautiful way to see Boston!

Boardwalk.  Canoes and paddleboats.  Accessible by bike or car.

Very busy but one of the best spots to hop onto the Charles by boat.
Fun, Exciting, and non-generic date idea. Be aware you WILL get tired but most importantly don't get ran over by other boats. Happy paddling!
Nice trail along the river and through the woods. It's short, only about a mile in total but worth visiting if in the area.
One of the prettiest trails I have ever done. Mostly flat and not too long. Dog and kid friendly.

I hike from my house through Cedariver EVERY day of the year except when on vacation. Takes about 25 minutes at a fast clip (I alternate clockwise and counterclockwise daily), and it's wonderful (except during bug season -- spray and only go very early in EEE season!). Seeing more deer during Covid era -- so restorative for the soul!  There's a magnificent oak -- hundreds of years old -- near the Charles.

My dog and I love cedar river!  The trail is simple and about a 30 minute walk and pleasant. Always check yourself for deer ticks afterwards (best way is to change your clothes!) Be aware, horse manure on the trails sometimes.

Georgeous woodsy leaf-change+pines 1 mile loop near The Charles. Touches the river in 1 spot. Did the loop both ways and explored a couple of side trails in about an hour, prob 2.5 mi. A few small hills, nothing major. Occasional evidence of horses.
Peaceful, well maintained and a perfect way to spend an hour or so if you enjoy a short hike. Also a great place to check out the Charles river.
Beautiful spot, a little less than a mile. BEWARE OF TICKS!!!!! We pulled about 25+ off my dogs after about 20 minutes here and staying on the trail the whole time.
A short loop, with several river views, some lovely meadows, and lots of bird/frog song (at least in September).  An easy walk with only a slight hill in one section.

We absolutely had a blast on our cycle cruise !!  We celebrated our friends 60th birthday in style !  I loved the added features of coolers WITH ice all ready for us !!!  It was great that we could bring our own munchies and beverages.  Captain Bob and his first mate were so friendly and helpful.   I can't wait to do this again with my family
Great for groups! Beautiful views of the entire city. Highly recommend! They let you bring your own drinks and snacks on board.
A beautiful way to spend an evening!  It was such a fun way to celebrate a birthday. The weather cooperated and the views were stunning.

Great afternoon on the harbor with Captain Bob and First Mate Alex.  This is truly a perfect way to spend an hour and a half with family and friends.  Bob and Alex were top notch and cannot wait to sail with them again.   Boats n' H***!   This is a must do for everyone who is not afraid 9f a good time.

Been on cycleboat 3 times and always have the best time!!

here's what you need to know about the 1.5 hour tour:
1. You aren't required to cycle/pedal (surprising, right?)
2. Coolers with ice are provided but feel free to bring your own drinks + snacks
3. In addition to the cycle seats there is comfortable lounge seating
4. Make sure to bring your aux cord friend because you get to play your own music
5. Select boats can fit up to 20-26 people
6. Tours are offered during the morning, afternoon and sunset
7. You can book a public or private tour
8. Views are always 10/10
9. Weekday and weeknight pricing is often better than weekends, up to 30% less in some cases, and weekday/weeknight cruises can be a great way to unwind after work or a busy day.

@michaela_romanosmith

We had the best experience with cycle boat. The staff was so kind and accommodating when the sister of the birthday boy was running late. They even did their best to give us a lil extra time since we launched late. Such a fun experience being on the water and they did everything to make sure we had as much fun as possible. We will definitely be booking again for future events

A group of 3 friends and I had the best time!  Captain Phil, Chris and Rosie were great. Beautiful views, just enough info on historical sites and they were so nice about taking group photos for us. Highly recommend!

Captain Phillip and captain Jack were amazing! They made our first cycle boat experience incredible. Captain Philip had great knowledge on Boston and catered to our needs to make it enjoyable. I can't wait to come back and do this again!

Reached out to the CRWA Executive Director, Emily Norton, about a heating oil leak into the Muddy River. I was met with a zero effort response with zero interest. Highly disappointed. Might as well throw their mission statement out the window. See photo for more info on this ongoing oil discharge.
Excellent organization with knowledgeable and helpful staff. Enjoyed several of their public outreach events, hope to attend more in the future.
I'm sure it's nice, but it's only on my timeline because it's located at Leo J Martin golf course.

This is a good area for walking, but I didn't like that the entire trail was along or close to the highway. So we listened to the sounds of cars the entire walk.
We walked all the way and it took 1.40 hours (4.3 miles)
Today is very nice, Windy but not too cold. Good for walking around.
Great place to hike , signage is a little tired and could do with a refresh

Huge park containing multitudes. Transcendent boardwalk traversing a cattail bog. Old growth forest. Mountain bike jumps. Charles River access. Legitimate lake (swimming forbidden as with every other lake in Eastern Mass but I witnessed a local gymnastics camp of 30-40 girls swimming and lo - pretty sure they all survived!)

A lovely loop around a large pond sandwiched between 128 and the Charles river. While the main loop is lovely the real hidden gem of this park is the long network of trails through the riverside marshes down towards Dedham.

Cutler Park Reservation is a beautiful natural reservation to explore. Cutler Pond is very beautiful to walk around and takes less than an hour to. The reservation is also great for mountain biking as well. Today I went through the Dedham side on the boardwalk and walked to the train tracks. The reservation is great for nature lovers, mountain bikers and anyone who wants to enter nature without much challenge. I definitely recommend visiting.

Very nice to walk! You'll see many people with their dogs. Some parts are not easy if you are in you bike but you will enjoy it. Parking is always enough because is not very crowded and it's free!
Feel the air, listen the birds, stay in peace :)
Impressive work of beavers or otters! Amazing home they made!

Bucolic! Well-marked trails offer varying degrees of difficulty. We stayed on the red trail and enjoyed solitude except for crossing paths with the occasional runner or family. I'd bring lunch to eat by the canoe landing area if I were return. Not much parking, but you can prepare with info from the Trustees website.
Excellent trails.  Some quite steep and needing attention to hike.  Overlooks, water and some swamp if you want it.  All accessed through a pastoral meadow.
Great trails that were well marked. Loved the overlook points. Part of the orange trail was completely flooded over so we had to double back to get back to the main trail

Very nice, quiet, dog-friendly park. The main red loop is about 2 miles and is very well marked with varied terrain. The parking lot is very small. Online it says the lot is limited to 6 cars but on site the sign says the limit is 5.

I Thank You Long open fields, a few homes to be aware of, as well as fellow ongoers, but awe-inspiring natural diversity. A place to Appreciate! Especially when the reason why the area is called the Rocky Narrows becomes clear. Mindful walking, peaceful while wondering the ascent, you may just find a lil pocket of serenity elevated stillness. If not, there's more than plenty to be grateful for during a stroll.

A very moderate hike with big pay off. The part above the Charles River is by far the prettiest. Being there in mid summer views of the river below were scant but I could here the distant sound of paddling. The trail was lush and absolutely gorgeous. Only met a couple of other hikers mid week
Excellent place for trails! Our dog especially loved the no - leash area. Fantastic view from the peak too.

Nice trails. A few downed trees but overall well maintained and marked. Went to King Philip's overlook with two kiddos under 7. Parking is limited to 5 cars at Forest & Lake so have backup plan if going on weekend.

It is a nice little park for kids and for others. The pavement goes around the park like a track field, great for walks and running. Wish the park was more friendly towards trash, there's a lot on the ground; not great for the animals. Wish owners did not unleash their dogs too, makes me nervous while there is a road nearby.

Amazing Fresh Food and  great service.
Was able to walk in without reservations ! Was still able to get a get spot with the view of the TV .  Homemade sangria very tasty, got the Fried Chicken sandwich! Nicely cooked and delicious!
Definitely will be back .
Cambridge Common is a very historic and beautiful common to visit. It is plenty big with lots of walking space. The historical plaques and sites here are quite worth seeing!
