review_text: I was looking for a local swimming hole for my pup that's easily accessible, and this is it. It's quiet, beautiful, well kept and great for a variety of activities inckuding fishing, short walks, picnics and sunbathing. Dog approved, too.

Lovely although also a lunch spot for trucks..and the occasional tryst. The path through the chained road takes you to the Newton playground and nice entry into the Charles. Also parking and tennis court. Keep parallel to the path & nature presents itself very quickly.  Great spot for children no good for dogs along that path.
Learned to fish there as a kid in the 60s. My Grandparents house was right across the street. Great memories.
Like to throw the rod in the water every once in a while Never really caught much

Great little park to escape the city. Plenty of room for walking. Birdwatching is great here as a lot of the little fellas hang out. Get out of the house and go explore a little bit of nature in the city.

Fresh pond reservation is beautiful.  I love being there at the end of the day.  It is so good to have a place where you can be in nature in the midst of the city. Also they have clean public restrooms.
Fabulous eclipse viewing event! Fun live music, inviting and comfortable community spirit.

Fresh Pond Reservation is a reservoir and park in Cambridge, MA. It is a great place to go for a walk, jog, walk the dog, or bird watch. It is a mostly paved trail of 2.25 miles around the reservoir. You can even let dogs swim in the Little Fresh Pond Dog Beach. A little bit of excitement was when the equivalent of the Loch Ness Monster was sighted recently, and the locals have named the elusive creature the Loch Fresh Monster or Freshie.

Nice little park with a mostly shady 2.5 mile loop around a reservoir.

Unfortunately there are way too many irresponsible dog owners walking their dogs off leash here. I had multiple dogs run up to me and their owners didn't seem to care or try to recall them with any urgency. I even saw a guy trying to get his unleashed dog to come back to the correct side of the fence around the reservoir because it ducked under a hole in the fence.
If you're nervous around dogs at all, avoid this park.

The scenery is pretty nice, but the tall chain link fence around most of the pond makes you feel corraled into a narrow corridor for a good chunk of time.

Also, many of the parallel trails don't have great interconnection, so there aren't many ways to vary your route.

Add in how few benches are around the pond and I was a bit disappointed.

I'd walk through if I was in the area, but I don't plan on making specific plans to return.

Beautiful place!!
I like running or going on a walk there. There's a trail that's track like that you can run/walk. And it surrounds the pond.

This is a sweet spot for biking, walking, sledding, and birdwatching. Lots of paths to explore, or just stay on the main path around the reservoir that is Cambridge's water supply. Top tier picnic spot as well. Be warned though my friends, you can get lost in a circle.

Puddlestompers is a wonderful nature-based program for children ages 4-8. They offer summer camps, vacation week, and holiday camps. My son *loves* going there. I was a bit nervous the first time I sent him, but when he came home, he said, "Mommy, I want to go to Puddlestompers whenever they are open." So I promised him I'd send him for next vacation week :)   If your child likes exploring nature, I'd highly recommend this unique and stimulating program!
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Ilana,
Thank you for your review! We love having your son at our programs, and it was so much fun to teach him about nature and explore the outdoors with him! We hope to see him again during one of our upcoming programs!

review_text: The Puddlestompers program was a shining light during our pandemic year. Not only were the staff very COVID-protocol aware, but they became one of the few adults in their lives to encourage, support, and nurture my children's love of learning (Habitat Classes).  My 3 and 7 year-old always returned home from the summer camp with huge smiles, art projects, and celebrated new knowledge about the natural world.  I highly recommend this program!
response_from_owner_text: We are touched to hear how our programs have impacted your children in such a positive way. We look forward to exploring with them in the future!

review_text: Wonderful program that connected my young daughter with the outdoors. She came home dirty, happy, and bubbling with stories about her daily adventures. The staff is engaged and the operation is well-run. Would recommend to any family.
response_from_owner_text: It is wonderful to hear your daughter had so many happy experiences during her programs with us! We strive to run safe, fun, engaging programs so kids can come home bubbling with stories of their daily adventures as you so aptly put it.

review_text: My son had a wonderful summer exploring nature with puddlestompers.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Arielle,
Thank you for your review! We had a blast exploring nature with your son this Summer!

review_text: Our 5 year old LOVES puddlestompers!!
Attentive staff, my kid loves it!
response_from_owner_text: Hi Sara, we are so glad to hear your child loved learning with PUDDLESTOMPERS!

Hi Ronald,
We've looked in our system, and can't seem to find any record of classes that you've taken with us. We're so sorry to hear that you didn't enjoy PUDDLESTOMPERS, and would love to remedy that.  If you could get back to us with the date and class type, we would be happy to see how we can help make all future experiences better.

Best,
The PUDDLESTOMPERS Team

review_text: Beautiful view of the city from across the Charles River, especially as sunrise when you see scullers paddling by!

There are bike lanes on this bridge so it is an easy place to cross by bike or on foot. It does get pretty windy so be prepared for that especially when it is cold. The view of Boston from the bridge is amazing and worth pausing on your walk. There is also a pedestrian walkway down to the Charles River Esplanade on the Boston side
A good stop for some photos as a tourist. Beautiful during the day and night.
Beautiful to walk across and see the sail boats and witness runners going from the Cambridge to the Boston side , and vice versa.

You can clearly see the view of downtown Boston and Cambridge campus through this bridge. Lots of people are jogging on this bridge and I think this bridge is definitely safe for pedestrians! Sometimes you can see someone is rowing the boats on the river. In spring, Cherry blossom a lot!

The bridge connects Massachusetts Ave across Charles Rivers. A main thoroughfare for vehicles, and pedestrians   to travel between Boston in the south and Cambridge in the north. There are two lanes for vehicles plus one pedestrian lane for each direction. It is recommended visitors to cross the bridge by foot to enjoy the scenery. During morning or late afternoon, weather permitted, many runners, walkers cross the bridge in either direction. The Charles River Esplanade, on the Boston side of the river bank, is a must visit. The Esplanade spreads few miles from the Boston University Bridge on the west side to Longfellow Bridge on the east side.
Its amazing to ride a cycle or to walk on Harvard Bridge and you can witness some amazing boston skyline here with a great charles river view
Usefull and also a beautiful view on Boston and Cambridge

We chartered the Adirondack to celebrate my father's life with our family and friends. My Dad was an avid sailor and we wanted to honor his memory with something that was really special - and this was exactly that. The schooner is absolutely beautiful, in immaculate condition, comfortable and surprisingly fast. Captain Turner was warm, welcoming and very generous with his time while commandeering the helm with an easy and confident calm about him. Under his relaxed but watchful eye he gave those interested an opportunity to helm Adirondack. This is something I highly recommend. It's a thrilling and impressionable experience for anyone of any ability. The crew was extremely attentive, professional and accommodating. The food and beverage was all high quality and better than expected on board a charter vessel. Hailing from Rowes Wharf behind the Boston Harbor Hotel, the Boston skyline views and Harbor Island vistas underway can't be matched. If you're looking to create a memorable experience for family, friends, colleagues, etc. under the power of tranquil sails (versus noisy powerboats) - make this your next venture! Sail on...

Came from out of town and decided to do the cruise. It was an amazing experience however we were kind of bummed we didn't get upstairs seating. My kids were disappointed to say the least. For that reason I'm giving it 4 stars but the crew was great! Pretty cool to see the planes from Boston Logan fly over as well.

Check-in point was easily located. A little delay in boarding; the cruise finished on time. Wonderful views of the harbor and the sights along the shore. Captain narrated portions of the trip with useful and interesting information. Very impressive to be under the flight path of approaching planes landing at Boston-Logan Airport. The "Northern Lights" has plenty of seating options topside and bottom. Did not use any of the food/beverage amenities.

The brunch cruise on Northern Lights was just what we were looking to do during an afternoon in Boston. The food was good and plentiful, the narration of sights was informative, the boat had comfortable seating, plenty of restrooms, and the staff was friendly and helpful. The price was just right too. I'd definitely return for the sunset cruise in the future.
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Vicky,

Thank you for booking a brunch cruise with us and taking some time to leave a review. We are glad that the trip was a success and that you found it to be well worth your time. We look forward to welcoming you back aboard for a sunset cruise or perhaps a sail on our schooner!

Warmly,
Classic Harbor Line Boston

review_text: We did the Sunset Cruise in Boston Harbor and thoroughly enjoyed it. Seeing the planes take off and land from the Harbor was a cool experience especially when they started flying over the boat. Seeing the Skyline light up once it got dark was very nice. This was a great experience, and I felt it was very affordable for a 2 hour experience. I would highly recommend this
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Donnie,

Thank you for booking a cruise with us and taking some time to leave a review and recommendation. It is nice to know that you had an enjoyable time watching the planes and taking in the harbor views. We hope you will consider joining us again soon!

Warmly,
Classic Harbor Line Boston

review_text: Such a great brunch cruise! We chose the Northern Lights cruise over other brunch cruises because we liked that it was part "tour" and the vibe of the 1920s ship, and we were so happy that we did! Some of the reviews had said the food was "hotel continental breakfast", but if that's the case I'd love to know what hotels they are staying at, because while the food wasn't gourmet, it was pretty good (particularly the cinnamon rolls, potatoes, and salmon). We left port before the other brunch cruise, and returned after them, we got the full two hours, and a great informative tour, all while enjoying tasty food, and good service--it was worth every penny! And for anyone wondering, the majority of the tables are by windows, with one row of them in the center, but you can get up and walk around and there is a lovely covered deck with plenty of space to enjoy the views. We'll definitely be going again in the future!
response_from_owner_text:
Hello Kara,

Thank you for booking a brunch cruise with us and taking some time to leave a review. We are happy to hear that you enjoyed the food, the vibe, the service, and the tour. We appreciate the recommendation and look forward to your next visit!

Warmly,
Classic Harbor Line Boston

review_text: I booked this cruise a year ago and, through my own silliness, completely missed it! Classic Harbor's service team was so helpful getting me a credit to use at a later time and I'm actually glad it happened because when I did rebook we ended up with the most beautiful day!!! The staff was absolutely wonderful. They all made us feel so welcome and had great recommendations on sights to see around the area. The food also entirely exceeded my expectation in quality and quantity. I was expecting a basic continental breakfast type service, but it was a huge spread and all delicious! Great commentary on the scenery and history from the captain, but not too much to be obtrusive. I could not have been happier with this trip!! Entirely worth the cost and I highly recommend.
response_from_owner_text:
Hello Tara,

Thank you for booking a brunch cruise with us and taking some time to leave a review. We are happy to hear that the timing and weather worked out for your second attempt and that you enjoyed the food, the friendly service, and the light narration. We appreciate the recommendation and hope to have a chance to welcome you back aboard again soon!

Warmly,
Classic Harbor Line Boston

review_text:
I took my wife for a trip on Northern lights tour this past Saturday for mother's day trip on the Northern lights boat. The boat was Captained by Captain Jess. Captain Jess did a wonderful job and she was very knowledgeable about the whole Boston harbor area. The tour ride was a fun  tour.
It had a brunch set up and the crew did great. We all really appreciated Captain Jess for such a great ride and experience!
response_from_owner_text:
Hi Glen,

Thank you for booking a holiday brunch cruise with us and taking some time to leave a review. We are delighted that it was a great experience and that Captain Jess and the crew took great care of you. We hope to have the pleasure of welcoming you back aboard!

Warmly,
Classic Harbor Line Boston

review_text: The child swim classes are fun and at your own pace. All the activities were easy to follow for different ages. The classes were a fun way to introduce my daughter to water without being scared and learn valuable water basics.

Quite a good YMCA compared to what we have in Somerville. Decent facilities and classes. I have used their gym, classes, swimming pool, locker rooms and free weights section on multiple occasions over the last 1 year or so...

My daughter goes to their swim classes and has learnt more in 1 year than she learnt at the other schools in 2-3 years of going there...because the class sizes are small and the teachers are great at what they do! They love teaching and it shows. My daughter looks forward to her swim class each week, and a nice sense of camaraderie gets created in each group, they have adult classes but i havent joined.

they have a sauna by the pool which is nice... The toilets are in the locker room with the showers so you have to go up one floor...

The classes are also fun. I have tried Rezist, zumba, cycling and yoga. Good teachers, some of the better ones get booked out faster...

easy and fast check in, easy to find parking, sometimes free by the YMCA inner roads or for 1/2$ on the main roads... never had issues with parking... if you drive around a few times, someone or the other is leaving and you get a spot

The Charlestown YMCA is a great facility with great staff and group exercise instructors. The exercise equipment was just recently replaced and it's generally never too crowded to use a machine. I have recently started going to the group Spin classes and they are fantastic!

I love this YMCA I grew up going to this YMCA when I lived in the Basilica in the Charlestown Navy Yard. I believe you are a owner or renter of a condo within the Charlestown Navy Yard you have the privilege of having a free membership. This is a very classy YMCA and open to the community. It is also located in a very nice area as well
Great gym. New equipment. Casual environment. Friendly staff.
Very clean location and great price for a gym in the area. There is also a nice size pool and lots of fun group exercise classes
Not super crowded. Could use some updates but it has the gym, pool and classes.

My daughter has been taking swimming lessons here. She loves Paige, who not only is a fantastic teacher of the swimming technique, always safe and attentive, but she is also loving, fun, and patient which gives my daughter confidence and a desire to keep coming to a cold pool in the middle of the winter :) There are always varying skill levels and ages in the class and Paige is able to keep it challenging for each kid. We also had lessons with Yan in the past, who was also fantastic, in the same ways. I wish this YMCA offered additional sports activities for the kids which would then make sense for us to become members. Our community direly needs tennis, basketball, etc... please consider this.

Best travel retreats! Very organized, great guides and a good mix of activities + yoga! I most recently went to Utah with the SUPYO group and enjoyed all the hiking and views with great meals provided.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you for continuing to travel with SUP YO, Lauren!

review_text:
Loved this SUP Yo Adventure. Enjoyed paddle boarding, hiking, sweat lodges, Mayan Fire Ceremony, aerial yoga, cliff jumping & an amazing sound bath. The activities were challenging & pushed our limits. The people attracted to this experience were remarkably well suited & like minded. The location- Villa Sumaya, Lake Atitlan, GT was mystical & magic with volcanoes & gorgeous terrain.
The food was also excellent, well thought out & prepared. Loved the daily yoga & beautiful space we practiced in. Very zen location & sound of waves topped it off.
response_from_owner_text: Laura, thank you so much for your review. We are SO glad you said YES to this adventure and enjoyed the experience, location, like minded group of folks and got what you needed out of this week away for YOU.

review_text: Easy launch off pier. Andrea was friendly and knowledgeable. Hanging yoga time at the bay was awesome.  I will definitely do it again!

What a breath of fresh air this retreat was! Nestled in the White Mountains of New Hampshire, it was the escape I needed to reset, recharge, and refill myself up with all the goodness a yoga and hiking retreat has to offer. The house is so charming and Jana threw down on the food, it was delicious! Donna guided us through our spiritual journey and helped us begin to heal from our past. I met 12 amazing ladies from all walks of life who I get to call friends. Highly recommend this for anyone looking to unplug and also a great idea for a girls trip! You won't regret it!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you, Dana! It was a pleasure meeting you and your friends and I am still so impressed that ya'll traveled SO far to be with us here in NH:) We hope to see you all on another future adventure - near or far!

review_text: 5 stars does not even come close to describing my experience. From the food to the amazing people I met and the breathtaking scenery hands down the best trip I have ever taken by myself. To any women who have ever thought about  going on a women's retreat by themselves but are scared I say jump in with both feet you will not be disappointed. Thank you Jana for introducing me to the women retreat experience I am a fan for life.
response_from_owner_text: Angie, THANK YOU for this lovely review! We are beyond grateful that you found SUP YO and are so glad you have joined our tribe! We will see you soon on another adventure... xo

review_text:
I am so happy I did my first winter hike in NH with this group.
I want to thank you for giving me the opportunity to hike with the best group of hikers and leader.
Sup Yo you rock.
It was a short hike but just what I needed on this perfect weather wise day.
Can't beat 47degrees.
Thank you Sup yo
Roxanne L
response_from_owner_text: We are soooo happy that you joined us, Roxanne! YOU rock! We look forward to seeing you again soon:)

review_text: Advertised as Magical Guatemala Adventure absolutely nailed this trip.  From different very unique Mayan ceremonies to challenging activities, crossing this magical lake on a stand up paddle-board ( less than 100 people have done so in the past) to kayaking and cliff jumping, hiking, yoga and local market tour, an unforgettable experience. I have been on multiple SupYo Adventures and I am still amazed on the incredible likeminded people those tours attract. I always make new wonderful forever  friends , always, always fast bonding amazing group dynamic.
response_from_owner_text: This makes me so happy, Vera!  So glad you keep coming back for more adventures with SUP YO and meeting such great like minded friends on every journey. That is what is all about :) XOXO

review_text: What a day! We had the opportunity to hike with Bethany and she is a gift!  We hiked. We laughed. We enjoyed the most perfect day, and can't wait to do it all again!!! Thank you so much for this amazing day!
response_from_owner_text: Snow, Grey jays AND sledding! What a great day. Thanks for saying YES to todays adventure

review_text: Great place to kayak. It is on a calm section of the Charles River surrounded by trees that give shade and keep you cooler. The staff is friendly and helpful. The place is dog-friendly (our dog has his own lifejacket, so I don't know if they have lifejackets for dogs). A small disadvantage is that Commonwealth Ave. and I-90 are above the river and are rather noisy.

Had such a blast canoeing here. The river is super calm and had lots of wildlife to view (10+ swans, turtles, a heron perhaps). It was really calm and pleasant to paddle on.

The staff were super sweet and accommodating to my pup who was going for her first canoe ride.

Great experience, a place I would come back to!
Highly recommend Paddle Boston (Newton).  Calm, serene environment with lots of nature, beautiful birds, ducks, swans, egrets. Excellent, friendly and knowledgeable staff ready to assist.

Twenty minutes from Boston and you feel like you're in the middle of nowhere. That's more credit to the beauty of the Charles in this area than to the paddle company. But they're a friendly, knowledgeable staff that does a great job getting you into the water quickly.

Paddle Boston did a great job with establishing safety protocols before opening in 2020. I advise everyone to buy a seasons pass which is a great bargain and saves you the hassle to compete waivers every time. I like the way they established 3 stations to get through safely and the young people working there are always friendly and professional.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks so much Ivan!

review_text: Great fun paddling on the Charles River. The staff was helpful and courteous. Parking for the Auburndale boathouse is a short walk from the parking lot across the bridge.
Fantastically run social distancing experience.  Really smooth from beginning to end. Once we got beyond the highway overpasses(not too far) the beautiful vistas were a great reward.

Paddle downstream to enjoy the Lakes District of Charles, and you can reach the dead end at the Waltham dam, where Paddle Boston's Waltham location is. The Lakes stretch is mostly free from people, has some birds to watch and is generally quiet other than other kayakers. The river does pass by buildings that make it feel semi-urban. Their Nahanton Park location is more immersed in nature with no buildings for a stretch upstream and more wildlife. The Historic Boathouse location though is a better paddling workout, without so much shallow spots, and the river is mostly wide.

Urban Park near route 2 and some conservation land. You can hear the cars from the highway There is an industrial Park where I took these pictures. Very close to the Alewife T station and Bike trail that runs through Arlington and hooks to other bike trails in Cambridge and Belmont. Its good for what it is

I really enjoy this place, it's great for a quick walk or make it a little longer with the bike path that runs alongside it. Sometimes there are some good things to forage, I found some sumac (not pictured)... but most of the time it's just a great place to see how beautiful nature can be when fairly "untouched" by city life
Great for a walk and to look at all the mid april budding plants

A beautiful natural path winding elegantly through the luxury apartments of North Cambridge. Biking and walking trails flank bodies of water containing swans, ducks, geese, and assorted birds. Wooden dock-like walkways also stretch across certain ponds.

A great little walk, so close to the city but it feels like you are in your own piece of nature.  Gets you away from the noise and chaos for some fresh air.  I just love going for walks and runs in this area, plus so accessible being right next to the bike path and Alewife train station.

Lovely park and the part along the Fitchburg cutoff bike path has a nice series of boardwalks over the water. Beautiful and relaxing.

It is NEARLY fully accessible but some of the connections between sand paths and boardwalks are rough. The sand paths have sunk leading to ledges that were difficult to get my mobility scooter over.

This is a beautifully designed urban park with lots of activities and trails. The Fitchburg cutoff bike path goes through the park. There's a nice boardwalk trail through a marsh habitat. You can see lots of different bird species, frogs, turtles etc. There is another shorter trail in the park which takes you near Cambridge Discovery Park. This area has lots of picnic benches and rocking chairs to enjoy a relaxing picnic in the park. There are bike rental stations near Alewife T station and on Acorn Park drive from where you can rent a bike and explore this area. An ideal place for a little urban excursion on a spring or summer's day.
Park, walk way... Ducks, Deers and Turtles in Summer! A good place for people of all age to enjoy.

Just summited my first 4000-footer with Guineafowl and I can not say enough about Dave, Serra, and the amazing experience they provide! A group of us hiked Mt. Pierce as part of Fjallraven's VinterVandering contest, and both Fjallraven and Guineafowl made sure everyone had everything they needed to have the perfect hiking experience, from transportation, to awesome gear, to the most valuable hiking tips and more. Every aspect of the hike (as well as the van ride there and back) was super comfortable - not once did I have to worry about anything - Dave navigates like a boss and makes sure you are eating and staying hydrated. Getting above tree line and reaching the peak felt like a dream - totally breathtaking. I loved every second! There is absolutely nothing better than spending a day on the mountain with an amazing group of people. With Guineafowl you can rest assured that you are in the hands of some of the most experienced, knowledgable, and friendly guides you'll ever meet. They make the mountains accessible to everyone! Definitely going on more hikes with them in the future!!!
response_from_owner_text: Jonathan - thank you for the kind words!  We had an incredible time hiking with you and the entire Fjallraven VinterVandring group - I really look forward to seeing you again on the trails!

review_text: Such an incredible experience this past weekend with Guineafowl Adventures climbing Mt. Kearsarge! Late winter/early spring weather being so variable can be an obstacle, but with Dave and Serra planning and leading the trip I knew it would be a safe and exciting adventure. They pour their extensive experience and training and passion into these trips. With all necessary gear provided including backpacks, spikes, poles, gaitors, even water and snacks; as well as clean and comfortable transportation, optimal trail routes, all provided, it's without question the way to go. Dave is awesome about answering questions and communicating trip info, you know he really cares that you have an amazing experience hiking in the mountains. I highly recommend you give yourself the gift of adventuring with Guineafowl!!! Come with friends or family, or sign up individually and perhaps make new friends, you'll be glad you did!!!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you so much for your warm words, Helen!  We are so happy you had an amazing day, it was such a fun hike up (and down) Mt. Kearsarge, especially getting to break trail a little bit above treeline!  We can't wait to see you again!

review_text: I did the Mt. Pierce hike with the tour guide Dave. It was an amazing experience from start to finish. I really appreciated that he coordinated a call with all the clients of the tour to answer questions and concerns days before the hike and coordinate the pick up . He sends an email with the weather forecast the day before the hike to dress appropriately for the weather. The transportation it was on time, the gear provided of great quality and the snacks delicious. The hike it was beautiful, loved the landscape and having the opportunity to enjoy this place in the fall, with all the leaves changing color. Dave was an extraordinary guide, very friendly and you can tell that he loves his job. I really recommend booking one of this tours if you want to hike in the white mountains with all the safety measures and without worrying about driving.I will definitely book another hike!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Isabel!  It was such a great day with the colors of Fall and the perfect temperature!  I had a great time hiking with you, and cannot wait to see you again for your next hike!

review_text:
I can't say enough good things about Guineafowl. I had the opportunity to go on a guided hike in the White Mountains with staff and other customers from Fjallraven Seaport. It was one of the most amazing experiences I've ever had in the outdoors.
Our guides, Dave and Serra, were friendly and welcoming and made sure everyone was fully prepared and safe on the hike starting with an orientation meeting the week before.
On the day of the hike, we were picked up in Boston and driven to the trailhead in a really nice and comfortable van. When we got to the trail, we were all given bags packed with water, snacks, and all of the gear that we might need.
The hike itself was really amazing and it's hard to put it into words how much I enjoyed it. Dave and Serra kept a good pace for the group and made sure that everyone was comfortable and safe on the hike and they told a few good stories along the way. After the hike, we stopped for some snacks and packed up for a ride back to Boston.
I had never considered a guided hike before and now I'm completely convinced that it is the way to go. I was able to spend my time enjoying nature and learning a few things along the way without having to worry about following a map or if I had all of the right gear. I really can't wait to go on another hike with Guineafowl.
response_from_owner_text: Andy, it was so great hiking with you and the Fjallraven VinterVandring group!  I'm so happy to hear that you enjoyed your time, and I love that you hadn't considered a guided hike before and that we helped you relax and enjoy your surroundings!  We can't wait to see you again!

review_text:
Dave and Serra took ten of us up Mt. Crawford and it was a fantastic experience. We were picked up in a comfortable and spacious van and driven to the trailhead. Our packs came fully equipped with all of the necessities, hydration, snacks, microspikes, gaiters, snow shoes, and poles. Dave took point to pace the group with Serra in the rear, ensuring that every member of the hike had access to one or the other throughout no matter the hiker's ability to make pace. Upon completion we were driven back and dropped off right where we started the day as if the whole experience, the planning and effort it entailed on the guide's end, had been some kind of dream.
No equipment malfunctions, never a cause for concern. 5/5 looking forward to my next Guineafowl adventure.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Tyler!  We had such a great time hiking with your group - Mt. Crawford was gorgeous that day, we really got the full experience, fresh powder on the trails, and even a new snowstorm when we summitted!

review_text: My son went on a hike with several middle schoolers on the Welch-Dickey loop, NH, with Guineafowl Adventure Company and absolutely loved it! The guide Dave Fatula was wonderful, supportive and my son came home with a smile on his face and asked when he could go on another one! I highly recommend this!
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Diem!  We love getting the next generation out into the wilderness and your feedback is so important and helpful!  We can't wait for the next season's hiking club and many more after that!

review_text: Great morning at Lonesome Lake in the January snow!  They definitely know the trail and prepared everything for the hike. I even came away more knowledgable about my personal hiking technical improvements and future White Mountain excursions.  Will definitely hike with them again.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Gerri!  We look forward to hiking with you again, it was a fun day visiting the Hut and hiking around the Lake!

review_text: I couldn't recommend Guineafowl and Dave more. It is an ideal way to conveniently enjoy the beautiful White Mountains - you show up and hike and Guineafowl does the rest. We had novice to experienced people in our group and it was great for everyone.
response_from_owner_text: Thank you Teresa!  Knowing that you're an avid hiker, we are so grateful that you had an ideal experience and that you felt it was a good fit for all!

review_text: One of the best boat clubs I have been a member of, in the Boston area. A very convenient way to enjoy sailing with or without boat ownership. The selection of boats, support from Paul and Brian and the boating community that they have created here is remarkable. An orientation to get familiar with the boat, help at any time and well maintained boats make it easy to join and have made my sailing time here memorable.

Great organization!  Perfect way to get more experience on a bigger boat and to sail without all the hassle and expense of having your own boat. Also a great community of likeminded sailors.  The staff is very responsive and the boats are new and well maintained. Availability of the boats is excellent and there is always opportunity to spend more time of the boat if you book an open slot last minute. All for less than I would pay in slip fees plus storage.
response_from_owner_text: thanks for taking the time to write this, Mike

review_text: I've been a member of SailTime Boston for two years and love it. The quality of the boats in the program is superior compared to what I've seen in other shared sailing programs in the area, and I've had great interactions with the SailTime community.

I have been a member of SailTime Boston for 3 years. It has been a wonderful experience. The staff members are extremely knowledgeable and helpful. I had basic sailing skills but I signed up for sailing certification courses  with First Reef Sailing, a sister company. The courses were fun and I learned the skills required to feel comfortable sailing the larger boats. The boats are well equipped and maintained. Great Fun!!!!
response_from_owner_text: You've been an ideal member over the past 3 seasons Chuck, thanks for the review  happy to have you in the club

review_text: Now in our fourth year as members of SailTime, and have loved the convenience of sailing without the challenges of boat ownership. The SailTime team provide a great range of well maintained boats and are always available to support and provide advice. Collaborating with other members has allowed us to plan passages further afield, and we've enjoyed memorable trips to Martha's Vineyard, Nantucket and Buzzards Bay, as well as the regular trips around Boston Harbor Islands.

I've been a member for 3 years. I'm very happy with the membership, it tough me a lot about skippering your boat. If you have doubts about owning a boat this is for you, by far the best program in Boston with very low stakes since a membership gives you hassle free enjoyment of the boat. And from my point of view is an upgrade from any other club that you may have 6 30+ foot boats to choose from but not as impeccable this fleet.I've maximizing the sailing days and spent the night in one of the harbor islands or sail to P-town for a change, you can't do that on the Boston sailing clubs. Capt Paul, Brian and the rest of the crew (Richard, Forrest, etc) take good care of the boat and available for sailing classes. Highly recommend.
response_from_owner_text: Thanks for taking the time to write this review, Nico  you've been a great member for our club

review_text: This is my fifth sailing season as a SailTime member and boat owner.  If you are looking for a place to sail newer mono-hulls or cats from 35' to 50' in Boston, this is the place.  Very well run program, boats are well maintained and well managed.  When you step on a boat it is clean and everything works.  You can do day-sails around the harbor islands your friends and family or head to P-Town or Newburyport for the weekend.  If you are new to sailing, they have an affiliated sailing school - First Reef Sailing out of East Boston.  There is no easier way to do this kind of sailing.

If you want to sail in Boston but aren't ready to buy a boat, Sailtime is the best way to get on the water. Paul and crew are incredible sailors and wonderful people. The boats are well maintained and you get lots of sailing and no headaches. I love being a Sailtime member and highly recommend it.
